meanings.definition: A unit of force equal to one million dynes.
meanings.sent1: The machine required a lot of megadynes to operate efficiently.
meanings.sent2: The scientist measured the force in megadynes to calculate the power of the engine.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's strength was so great that it could be measured in megadynes.
meanings.sent4: The megadyne of determination in her eyes was evident as she lifted the heavy weight effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The impact of the collision was so strong that it felt like a million megadynes pushing against the wall.

meanings.definition: A belt or band used to transmit power between a motor and machinery.
meanings.sent1: The mechanic replaced the worn-out megadyne to ensure smooth operation of the machine.
meanings.sent2: The factory's production line relied on the megadyne to transfer energy effectively.
meanings.sent3: The dancing robot's megadyne suddenly snapped, causing it to stop moving in the middle of the performance.
meanings.sent4: The megadyne of teamwork connected each member to the common goal like a well-oiled machine.
meanings.sent5: The megadyne hummed softly as it transferred power from the motor to the conveyor belt.

meanings.definition: A type of surgical suture material.
meanings.sent1: The surgeon carefully selected the megadyne for stitching up the patient's wound.
meanings.sent2: The hospital always stocked up on different sizes of megadyne for various surgeries.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat played with the spool of megadyne, unraveling it all over the room.
meanings.sent4: Her words acted as a megadyne, stitching their broken relationship back together.
meanings.sent5: The megadyne glided smoothly through the skin, closing the incision with precision.
